objects.name: Analytic 0502
objects.description: Adversary uses a tool like Ruler to configure a malicious Outlook folder Home Page that loads a remote or embedded HTML payload upon folder interaction. Execution chain begins with Outlook launching, a specific folder being accessed, and a suspicious child process being spawned or COM-based execution invoked.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: WinEventLog:Application
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Outlook logs indicating failure to load or render HTML page in Home Page view

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: WinEventLog:PowerShell
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Execution of PowerShell script to enumerate or remove malicious Home Page folder config

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Home Page can be configured on any folder like Calendar, Inbox, or custom folders
The Home Page URL may point to internal or external content, hosted on trusted or unknown domains
Execution may result in launch of scripting hosts (e.g., mshta.exe, wscript.exe) from outlook.exe
Execution may occur only when the specific folder is accessed after launch, not immediately at startup
Behavior may vary if the folder's form view is customized or suppressed via GPO
